intro: Onosma oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to alpine climates. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
